title: Putty panels lose focus on touchpad scroll
author: randman1
body_snippet: I have found some strange behavior with panel focus in version 1.76.8.17254. Scrolling up or down using the laptop's touchpad in any panel containing a Putty session will cause focus to be lost to the main window. Scrolling works as long as my finger remains on the touchpad but as soon as I lift my finger off of the touchpad, the Putty session will no longer accept any additional input from the keyboard or mouse until the Putty session window is clicked again. iterations.description: Touchpad scrolling causes the container InterfaceControl to capture focus from the embedded Putty window.
Focus loss during scrolling disrupts user workflow and indicates improper handling of window messages (likely WM_MOUSEWHEEL) between the hosting form and the embedded PuTTY window.
Touchpad scrolling causing focus loss in embedded PuTTY sessions indicates a window message handling issue in the embedding container.

notes:
AI triage (gemini): Touchpad scrolling causes the container InterfaceControl to capture focus from the embedded Putty window.
Approach: Override OnGotFocus and OnMouseWheel in InterfaceControl to call Protocol.Focus().
AI triage (gemini): Focus loss during scrolling disrupts user workflow and indicates improper handling of window messages (likely WM_MOUSEWHEEL) between the hosting form and the embedded PuTTY window.
Approach: Investigate message filters in FrmMain or the connection container to ensure scroll events do not inadvertently trigger focus shifts away from the embedded PuTTY window, potentially by forwarding the message or suppressing default focus behavior.
AI triage (gemini): Touchpad scrolling causing focus loss in embedded PuTTY sessions indicates a window message handling issue in the embedding container.
Approach: Investigate WM_MOUSEWHEEL and focus handling for embedded windows; ensure scroll events do not trigger focus changes or bubbling that steals focus.
